title: Christian Li: The young Harry Potter fan on his music stardom
description: Christian Li, 12, Decca Classics' youngest artist, reveals how he relaxes when he isn't practising.

title: 'After mum died, no-one talked about her for 15 years'
description: Iain Cunningham always knew his birth had something to do with his mum's death when he was three.

title: Rethink: Pope Francis warns poor have become part of landscape
description: Pope Francis laments the "hypocrisy" of certain politicians in one of a series of essays for the BBC.

title: Arianna Huffington: 'Take time to recharge'
description: The author and founder of Thrive Global says companies need a new leadership playbook during the virus.

title: 'I used to hate road cycling, now I design biking gear'
description: Remi Clermont is the founder and boss of cycling clothing firm Cafe du Cycliste.

title: Coronavirus in Nigeria: Changing women's representation through photography
description: Etinosa Yvonne's photographs challenge stereotypical representations of women during the pandemic.

title: Glastonbury Festival: 50 years of memories
description: Images from attendees of Glastonbury Festival, which was due to celebrate a big anniversary this year.

title: Coronavirus: Social tree climbing 'boosts mental health'
description: A Hampshire company that teaches tree climbing has seen a surge in interest as lockdown eases.

title: Neo-Nazi militant group grooms teenagers
description: BBC One's Panorama reveals covert recordings of teenagers being groomed by a neo-Nazi militant group.

title: Black Lives Matter: Parents and children talk about racism
description: Three black parents and their children discuss raising a black child, racism and the Black Lives Matter movement.

title: Portable changing rooms and a saxophone player - a 'suitably surreal' Merseyside derby draw
description: Everton's goalless stalemate with Liverpool was a derby like no other with no fans present, writes BBC Sport's chief football writer Phil McNulty.

title: William’s double celebration on Father's Day
description: The prince, who turns 38 on Sunday, posed for photographs at home with his three young children.

title: Reading stabbings: PM Johnson says he is 'appalled' by Reading attack
description: Police have arrested one man and declared the stabbings that left three people dead a terrorist incident.

title: Coronavirus: Government to 'bring forward proposals' on reducing 2m social distancing rule
description: Matt Hancock says he "very much hopes" to lower the social distancing measure in England.

title: Father of Paisley fire victims: 'Rest in peace little angels'
description: The siblings, aged, 12, eight and five, died after the fire in Paisley and their mother's condition remains critical.

title: Stolen book of late mother's writings returned to owner
description: Libby Day's mother prepared the book for her before she died but it was stolen from Miss Day's car.

title: Seven die in separate Somali bomb attacks
description: Militants blow up their car at a military checkpoint and detonate bombs at a military official's house.

title: 'I'm jealous of football's minority representation' - ex-England cricketer Rainford-Brent
description: Former England cricketer Ebony Rainford-Brent says she is "very jealous" of the representation seen in football.

title: In pictures: Rare solar eclipse darkens Asia on the summer solstice
description: Skywatchers photographed the "ring of fire", where the moon passes between the Earth and the Sun.

title: Manchester shooting: Man dead and another critically injured
description: A 36-year-old man dies and a 21-year-old is in a critical condition after a shooting in Manchester.

title: 'Klopp will always be special to Liverpool'
description: Trent Alexander-Arnold says manager Jurgen Klopp "will always be special to the club" as Liverpool close in on their first league title in 30 years.

title: Donald Trump: Tulsa rally fails to draw expected crowds amid virus fears
description: The US president addressed a smaller than expected crowd in his first campaign rally since March.

title: Newspaper headlines: Stabbing 'horror' as knifeman goes on 'rampage'
description: The attack in a park in Reading, which left three people dead, leads many of Sunday's front pages.

title: 'Racism protests do not get to the root of the problem'
description: Qasim Lozano, says microaggressions that are more subtle and less blatant forms of racism have to be stamped out first.

title: The new way to travel if you're disabled and use access
description: The way disabled people travel has changed and so has the access on offer - here's what to expect.

title: 'I slept rough in London while seven months pregnant'
description: Sarah Kamati was heavily pregnant when she and her partner were rejected by the immigration system.

title: Life with a stoma: Is there enough mental health support for those facing surgery?
description: Stoma patients reveal the highs and lows of life-changing surgery and ask if enough mental health support is available, following the death of a man.

title: My Money: 'I wonder if my wallet or body will recover?'
description: Zak Hoblyn from London takes us through his week as a first-time buyer during the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: Container enthusiasm: How to grow lockdown veg in a tiny space
description: The lockdown gardening boom has become a phenomenon but how do you join if you don't have a garden?

title: Coronavirus quiz: Do you really know Britain's lockdown rules?
description: Take this quiz to test your knowledge of the government's advice on coronavirus during the summer in the UK .
